item.title: Consistency Patterns of Distributed Transaction
item.description: A distributed transaction is a set of operations on data that is performed across two or more data repositories. Consider 2 UPDATE SQL operations need to be performed across 2 separate databases where both operations need to be either successful or failed. In the case, SQL Transaction which is supported on a single node is no longer sufficient. Two-Phase Commit Protocol (2PC) In such transaction processing across multiple nodes, a Two-Phase Commit Protocol is sometimes implemented to coordinate all participated processes in a distributed transaction on whether to commit or abort and roll back the transaction.
